currentItem.name: HTML
currentItem.subTitle: Markup language for web UI
currentItem.description:
HTML is made out of tags. 
Tags can hold values with attributes.
 For example: 
<html attribute="attribute value">

parts.embed:
<iframe src="https://codesandbox.io/embed/white-cloud-zyegl?autoresize=1&codemirror=1&fontsize=15&hidenavigation=1&theme=dark"
     style="width:100%; height:500px; border:0; border-radius: 4px; overflow:hidden;"
     title="white-cloud-zyegl"
     allow="accelerometer; ambient-light-sensor; camera; encrypted-media; geolocation; gyroscope; hid; microphone; midi; payment; usb; vr; xr-spatial-tracking"

parts.title: HTML page structure
parts.description:
An html page is the base of the website.
It defines the HTML version, meta data and the elements of the page.
From displaying inputs to loading files, you can do a lot with a few steps in HTML
parts.bottomText: You can create your own html files like this "index.html" or "any-name_you_want.html" and open it in your browser just by double clicking on it.

parts.title: The Anchor tag, linking the web.
parts.description: An achor tag can redirect the user to any page online or other files on you machine.

parts.title: The Image tag, displaying images.
parts.description: An image tag can show an image online or from on you computer.

parts.title: The input tag gets different types of input from the user. <input type="text" />
parts.description: With the input tag and the select and option tags you can ask the user many different types of questions to get his input.
